title: Feature: Publish toon_rust as library crate to crates.io
description:
## Overview

Publish toon_rust to crates.io as a library crate with both lib and bin targets, enabling Rust projects to use TOON encoding/decoding without spawning a subprocess.

## Background

Currently toon_rust is only available as a binary (`tru`). This works for CLI tools and bash scripts, but Rust projects that want TOON support must:
1. Shell out to the binary (subprocess overhead)
2. Parse stdout/stderr (fragile)
3. Handle binary availability (may not be installed)

A library crate solves all these issues.

## Proposed API

```rust
// lib.rs
pub fn encode(json: &str) -> Result<String, ToonError>;
pub fn encode_value(value: &serde_json::Value) -> Result<String, ToonError>;
pub fn decode(toon: &str) -> Result<String, ToonError>;
pub fn decode_value(toon: &str) -> Result<serde_json::Value, ToonError>;

// With options
pub fn encode_with_options(json: &str, opts: EncodeOptions) -> Result<String, ToonError>;

pub struct EncodeOptions {
    pub delimiter: Delimiter,      // Comma, Tab, Pipe
    pub indent: usize,             // Default 2
    pub key_folding: KeyFolding,   // Off, Safe
    pub flatten_depth: Option<usize>,
}
```

## Cargo.toml Structure

```toml
[package]
name = "toon"
version = "0.2.0"

[lib]
name = "toon"
path = "src/lib.rs"

[[bin]]
name = "tru"
path = "src/main.rs"
```

## Usage Examples

```rust
use toon::{encode, decode};

let json = r#"{"name": "test", "values": [1, 2, 3]}"#;
let toon_output = encode(json)?;
let roundtrip = decode(&toon_output)?;
assert_eq!(json, roundtrip);
```

## Benefits

1. **No subprocess overhead** - Direct function calls
2. **Type safety** - Rust error handling
3. **Composability** - Use in pipelines, iterators
4. **Testability** - Unit test TOON encoding in Rust projects
5. **Discoverability** - Found via crates.io search

## Migration Path

- Existing binary users: No change (bin target still works)
- New Rust projects: `cargo add toon` and use library API
- UBS: Could optionally include as dependency if rewritten in Rust

## Dependencies

None - can be done independently.

## Notes

This work happens in the toon_rust repository.
Consider whether to rename the crate from `toon_rust` to just `toon`.

title: Epic: Automate toon_rust binary installation in UBS installer
description:
## Overview

The UBS installer (`install.sh`) must automatically download and install the toon_rust `tru` binary as part of the standard installation process. Users should NOT need to manually:
- Download toon_rust
- Build from source
- Set TOON_TRU_BIN/TOON_BIN environment variable
- Configure shell profiles

Everything must be fully automated, just like ast-grep, ripgrep, and jq installations are today.

## Background & Rationale

### Current State
- UBS supports `--format=toon` for ~50% smaller output (optimized for LLM token efficiency)
- TOON encoding uses the toon_rust `tru` binary (Node.js toon CLI is not permitted)
- User must manually set `TOON_TRU_BIN=/path/to/tru` to force the fast Rust version
- This friction means most users miss the fast Rust encoder by default

### Why This Matters
- toon_rust is ~10x faster than the Node.js implementation
- No Node.js runtime dependency required
- Consistent with UBS philosophy: batteries-included, zero-config
- TOON format is critical for AI/LLM workflows where token efficiency matters

### Naming Conflict Issue
- Original toon_rust binary name conflicted with the Unix translate command
- Solution: use the `tru` binary name everywhere and install as `tru` in ~/.local/bin
- UBS already sets `TOON_TRU_BIN`, so the binary name is abstracted away

## Success Criteria
1. Fresh UBS install automatically downloads platform-appropriate toon_rust binary
2. Binary installed to ~/.local/bin/tru (or platform equivalent)
3. TOON_TRU_BIN automatically configured (shell profile or ubs internal default)
4. `ubs --format=toon` works out-of-box with Rust encoder
5. No Node.js fallback (only toon_rust)
6. Works on Linux (x86_64, arm64) and macOS (x86_64, arm64)

## Architecture Notes
- Follow existing patterns from install.sh (see ast-grep, ripgrep, jq downloads)
- Use GitHub releases for binary distribution
- Verify checksums for security
- Support --dry-run for testing

title: Infra: Set up toon_rust GitHub releases with platform binaries
description:
## Task

Configure toon_rust repository to publish pre-built `tru` binaries for all supported platforms via GitHub releases.

## Required Release Assets

For each release (e.g., v0.1.1), publish:
- `tru-linux-amd64.tar.xz` - Linux AMD64
- `tru-linux-arm64.tar.xz` - Linux ARM64
- `tru-darwin-amd64.tar.xz` - macOS Intel
- `tru-darwin-arm64.tar.xz` - macOS Apple Silicon
- `tru-windows-amd64.zip` - Windows AMD64
- `*.sha256` files for each asset

## Implementation Options

1. **GitHub Actions workflow** (recommended)
   - Cross-compile on release tag push
   - Use `cross` for Linux targets
   - Native build for macOS via matrix

2. **Manual release process**
   - Document build commands for each platform
   - Less ideal but works

## Binary Naming

The binary inside the archive should be named `tru` (not `tru`) to:
- Avoid conflict with Unix `tru` command
- Make purpose clear
- Allow safe PATH inclusion

## Archive Structure

```
tru-linux-amd64.tar.xz
└── tru  (the binary)
```

## Reference

See how ast-grep does releases:
https://github.com/ast-grep/ast-grep/releases

## Dependencies

None - can be done in parallel with other work.

## Notes

This work happens in the toon_rust repository, not ultimate_bug_scanner.
The UBS installer will consume these release assets.

Implement `download_toon_binary()` function in install.sh following the established pattern from `download_binary_release()`.

```bash
download_toon_binary() {
  local platform="$1"  # linux or darwin
  local arch="$2"      # amd64 or arm64

}
```

## Implementation Details

1. **Construct download URL**

   ```bash
   local version="0.1.1"  # or fetch latest from GitHub API
   local asset="tru-${platform}-${arch}.tar.xz"
   local url="https://github.com/Dicklesworthstone/toon_rust/releases/download/v${version}/${asset}"
   ```

2. **Download and verify**
   - Use existing `verify_download_checksum()` pattern
   - Fetch `${asset}.sha256` from release
   - Verify archive checksum before extraction

3. **Extract and install**
   - Extract to temp directory
   - Move binary to `$HOME/.local/bin/tru`
   - Set executable permissions (chmod +x)

4. **Error handling**
   - Log failures with context
   - Return non-zero on any failure
   - Don't leave partial installations

title: Core: Integrate toon_rust installation into main installer flow
description:
## Task

Add toon_rust binary installation to the main installer workflow, making it part of the standard UBS installation process.

## Integration Point

In install.sh, after other binary installations (ast-grep, jq, etc.), add:

```bash
# Install TOON encoder (toon_rust) for fast --format=toon support
install_toon_encoder() {
  local platform arch
  platform="$(detect_platform)"
  arch="$(detect_arch)"
  
  log "Installing TOON encoder (toon_rust)..."
  
  if download_toon_binary "$platform" "$arch"; then
    success "TOON encoder installed to ~/.local/bin/tru"
    # Update TOON_TRU_BIN in ubs script or shell profile
    configure_toon_bin
  else
    warn "TOON encoder installation failed. TOON output will be unavailable until tru is installed."
  fi
}
```

## Call Site

Add to main installation sequence (~line 1200-1300):
```bash
# After install_dependencies()
install_toon_encoder
```

## Conditional Installation

Consider making this optional with a flag:
- `--no-toon` to skip TOON encoder installation
- Default: install it

## Degradation Behavior

If toon_rust installation fails:
1. Log warning (not error)
2. Continue with installation
3. TOON output remains unavailable until tru is installed

## Dependencies

title: Core: Auto-configure TOON_BIN in ubs script
description:
## Task

Modify the ubs script to automatically detect and use the installed `tru` binary without requiring user configuration.

## Current State

```bash
# In ubs script (line ~147)
# TOON_BIN should default to tru (toon_rust); Node `toon` is forbidden
```

## Proposed Change

```bash
# Auto-detect toon_rust binary location (no Node.js fallback)
detect_toon_bin() {
  local candidates=(
    "$HOME/.local/bin/tru"     # Standard install location
    "$HOME/.cargo/bin/tru"     # Cargo install location
    "/usr/local/bin/tru"       # System-wide install
  )
  for bin in "${candidates[@]}"; do
    if [[ -x "$bin" ]]; then
      echo "$bin"
      return 0
    fi
  done
  # Fall back to PATH lookup
  if command -v tru >/dev/null 2>&1; then
    command -v tru
    return 0
  fi
  return 1
}

# Resolution order: TOON_TRU_BIN > TOON_BIN > tru (PATH)
TOON_BIN="${TOON_TRU_BIN:-${TOON_BIN:-tru}}"
```

## Why This Approach

1. **Zero user configuration** - Works out of box after installation
2. **Respects user override** - TOON_TRU_BIN/TOON_BIN env var still works
3. **No Node.js fallback** - Only toon_rust encoder is accepted
4. **Multiple install locations** - Supports different installation methods

## Location

Modify ubs script near line 147 where TOON_BIN is defined.

## Dependencies

- ultimate_bug_scanner-3a6.4 (Core: integration - binary must be installed first)

## Testing

- Fresh install: should auto-detect ~/.local/bin/tru
- Manual override: TOON_TRU_BIN=/custom/path should work
- Missing tru: should warn and fall back to JSON output (no Node.js)

title: Test: Verify toon_rust installation on Linux and macOS
description:
## Task

Create and execute comprehensive tests for toon_rust binary installation across all supported platforms.

## Test Matrix

| Platform | Architecture | Test Environment |
|----------|--------------|------------------|
| Linux | x86_64 | GitHub Actions ubuntu-latest |
| Linux | aarch64 | GitHub Actions ubuntu-latest (qemu) or self-hosted |
| macOS | x86_64 | GitHub Actions macos-13 |
| macOS | aarch64 | GitHub Actions macos-latest (M1) |

## Test Cases

### 1. Fresh Installation
```bash
# Clean environment (no existing ubs)
./install.sh
# Verify: ~/.local/bin/tru exists and is executable
# Verify: ubs --format=toon produces TOON output
```

### 2. Binary Verification
```bash
tru --version  # Should show toon_rust version
echo "{\"test\":1}" | tru  # Should produce TOON output
```

### 3. Integration Test
```bash
ubs --format=toon test-suite/buggy 2>&1 | grep -q "project:"
# Should use tru (check stderr for "Rust" or timing)
```

### 4. Fallback Test (no tru)
```bash
mv ~/.local/bin/tru ~/.local/bin/tru.bak
ubs --format=toon test-suite/buggy  # Should warn + fall back to JSON output (no Node)
```

### 5. Performance Comparison
```bash
time ubs --format=toon . > /dev/null  # With toon_rust
TOON_DEFAULT_FORMAT=json time ubs . > /dev/null  # Baseline JSON
# TOON should be faster and smaller than JSON output
```

## CI Integration

Add to existing GitHub Actions workflow or create new test-installer.yml:
```yaml
jobs:
  test-install:
    strategy:
      matrix:
        os: [ubuntu-latest, macos-latest, macos-13]
    runs-on: ${{ matrix.os }}
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - run: ./install.sh
      - run: ~/.local/bin/tru --version
      - run: ./ubs --format=toon test-suite/buggy
```

## Dependencies

- ultimate_bug_scanner-3a6.5 (Core: auto-configure - full implementation must be complete)

## Deliverables

- Test script or CI workflow
- Test results for all platforms
- Performance benchmarks

title: Runner/Installer: ast-grep version compatibility + PATH validation
description:
Problem:
- ubs pins ast-grep 0.40.1 for JS/TS accuracy (tool-cache auto-provision).
- install.sh binary fallback currently downloads ast-grep 0.18.0 and adds it to PATH.
- ubs preflight currently accepts any PATH ast-grep/sg if '--version' contains 'ast-grep' (no capability check).

Impact:
- On systems where installer uses binary fallback (no brew/cargo), users can end up with an old ast-grep in PATH. ubs will then prefer PATH and may break or misbehave if that version lacks required flags/output contracts (e.g. --json=stream/metaVariables) even though tool-cache would have provided the correct pinned build.

Goal:
- Make JS/TS scanning deterministic and reliable: if PATH ast-grep is unusable/outdated, ubs should ignore it and fall back to the verified tool-cache build.
- Align install.sh fallback download to the same pinned version (or at least a compatible minimum) so offline/locked-down users still get a working ast-grep at install time.

Acceptance criteria:
- ubs only uses PATH ast-grep/sg when it passes the same capability checks as doctor (e.g. 'scan -h' and '--json=stream' support as exercised by modules). Otherwise it auto-provisions (or uses) the tool-cache ast-grep 0.40.1.
- install.sh binary fallback for ast-grep downloads a compatible version and (ideally) warns if it can’t verify compatibility.
- Add/adjust a regression test that simulates a bogus/old 'ast-grep' on PATH and ensures ubs selects tool-cache instead.

title: Infra: Set up toon_rust GitHub releases with platform binaries
description:
## Task

Configure toon_rust repository to publish pre-built `tru` binaries for all supported platforms via GitHub releases.

## Required Release Assets

For each release (e.g., v0.1.1), publish:
- `tru-linux-amd64.tar.xz` - Linux AMD64
- `tru-linux-arm64.tar.xz` - Linux ARM64
- `tru-darwin-amd64.tar.xz` - macOS Intel
- `tru-darwin-arm64.tar.xz` - macOS Apple Silicon
- `tru-windows-amd64.zip` - Windows AMD64
- `*.sha256` files for each asset

## Implementation Options

1. **GitHub Actions workflow** (recommended)
   - Cross-compile on release tag push
   - Use `cross` for Linux targets
   - Native build for macOS via matrix

2. **Manual release process**
   - Document build commands for each platform
   - Less ideal but works

## Binary Naming

The binary inside the archive should be named `tru` (not `tr`) to:
- Avoid conflict with Unix `tr` command
- Make purpose clear
- Allow safe PATH inclusion

## Archive Structure

```
tru-linux-amd64.tar.xz
└── tru  (the binary)
```

## Reference

See how ast-grep does releases:
https://github.com/ast-grep/ast-grep/releases

## Dependencies

None - can be done in parallel with other work.

## Notes

This work happens in the toon_rust repository, not ultimate_bug_scanner.
The UBS installer will consume these release assets.

```bash
download_toon_binary() {
```

## Implementation Details

2. **Download and verify**

   - Fetch `${asset}.sha256` from release
   - Verify archive checksum before extraction

3. **Extract and install**
   - Extract to temp directory
   - Move binary to `$HOME/.local/bin/tru`
   - Set executable permissions (chmod +x)

4. **Error handling**

   - Return non-zero on any failure

## Task

Add toon_rust binary installation to the main installer workflow, making it part of the standard UBS installation process.

## Integration Point

In install.sh, after other binary installations (ast-grep, jq, etc.), add:

```bash
# Install TOON encoder (toon_rust) for fast --format=toon support
install_toon_encoder() {
  local platform arch
  platform="$(detect_platform)"
  arch="$(detect_arch)"
  
  log "Installing TOON encoder (toon_rust)..."
  
  if download_toon_binary "$platform" "$arch"; then
    success "TOON encoder installed to ~/.local/bin/tru"
    # Update TOON_TRU_BIN in ubs script or shell profile
    configure_toon_bin
  else
    warn "TOON encoder installation failed. TOON output will be unavailable until tru is installed."
  fi
}
```

## Call Site

Add to main installation sequence (~line 1200-1300):
```bash
# After install_dependencies()
install_toon_encoder
```

## Conditional Installation

Consider making this optional with a flag:
- `--no-toon` to skip TOON encoder installation
- Default: install it

## Degradation Behavior

If toon_rust installation fails:
1. Log warning (not error)
2. Continue with installation
3. TOON output remains unavailable until tru is installed

## Dependencies

- bd-3a6.3 (Core: download_toon_binary() function must exist)

## Testing

- Full installation on fresh system
- Installation with --no-toon flag
- Installation when download fails (network issues)

title: Core: Auto-configure TOON_BIN in ubs script
description:
## Task

Modify the ubs script to automatically detect and use the installed `tru` binary without requiring user configuration.

## Current State

```bash
# In ubs script (line ~147)
# TOON_BIN should default to tru (toon_rust); Node `toon` is forbidden
```

## Proposed Change

```bash
# Auto-detect toon_rust binary location (no Node.js fallback)
detect_toon_bin() {
  local candidates=(
    "$HOME/.local/bin/tru"     # Standard install location
    "$HOME/.cargo/bin/tru"     # Cargo install location
    "/usr/local/bin/tru"       # System-wide install
  )
  for bin in "${candidates[@]}"; do
    if [[ -x "$bin" ]]; then
      echo "$bin"
      return 0
    fi
  done
  # Fall back to PATH lookup
  if command -v tru >/dev/null 2>&1; then
    command -v tru
    return 0
  fi
  return 1
}

# Resolution order: TOON_TRU_BIN > TOON_BIN > tru (PATH)
TOON_BIN="${TOON_TRU_BIN:-${TOON_BIN:-tru}}"
```

## Why This Approach

1. **Zero user configuration** - Works out of box after installation
2. **Respects user override** - TOON_TRU_BIN/TOON_BIN env var still works
3. **No Node.js fallback** - Only toon_rust encoder is accepted
4. **Multiple install locations** - Supports different installation methods

## Location

Modify ubs script near line 147 where TOON_BIN is defined.

## Dependencies

- bd-3a6.4 (Core: integration - binary must be installed first)

## Testing

- Fresh install: should auto-detect ~/.local/bin/tru
- Manual override: TOON_TRU_BIN=/custom/path should work
- Missing tru: should warn and fall back to JSON output (no Node.js)

title: Test: Verify toon_rust installation on Linux and macOS
description:
## Task

Create and execute comprehensive tests for toon_rust binary installation across all supported platforms.

## Test Matrix

| Platform | Architecture | Test Environment |
|----------|--------------|------------------|
| Linux | x86_64 | GitHub Actions ubuntu-latest |
| Linux | aarch64 | GitHub Actions ubuntu-latest (qemu) or self-hosted |
| macOS | x86_64 | GitHub Actions macos-13 |
| macOS | aarch64 | GitHub Actions macos-latest (M1) |

## Test Cases

### 1. Fresh Installation
```bash
# Clean environment (no existing ubs)
./install.sh
# Verify: ~/.local/bin/tru exists and is executable
# Verify: ubs --format=toon produces TOON output
```

### 2. Binary Verification
```bash
tru --version  # Should show toon_rust version
echo "{\"test\":1}" | tru  # Should produce TOON output
```

### 3. Integration Test
```bash
ubs --format=toon test-suite/buggy 2>&1 | grep -q "project:"
# Should use tru (check stderr for "Rust" or timing)
```

### 4. Fallback Test (no tru)
```bash
mv ~/.local/bin/tru ~/.local/bin/tru.bak
ubs --format=toon test-suite/buggy  # Should warn + fall back to JSON output (no Node)
```

### 5. Performance Comparison
```bash
time ubs --format=toon . > /dev/null  # With toon_rust
TOON_DEFAULT_FORMAT=json time ubs . > /dev/null  # Baseline JSON
# TOON should be faster and smaller than JSON output
```

## CI Integration

Add to existing GitHub Actions workflow or create new test-installer.yml:
```yaml
jobs:
  test-install:
    strategy:
      matrix:
        os: [ubuntu-latest, macos-latest, macos-13]
    runs-on: ${{ matrix.os }}
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - run: ./install.sh
      - run: ~/.local/bin/tru --version
      - run: ./ubs --format=toon test-suite/buggy
```

## Dependencies

- bd-3a6.5 (Core: auto-configure - full implementation must be complete)

## Deliverables

- Test script or CI workflow
- Test results for all platforms
- Performance benchmarks

title: Docs: Update README and help text with TOON installation info
description:
## Task

Update all documentation to reflect the automated TOON encoder installation.

## Files to Update

### 1. README.md

Add to Installation section:
```markdown
### TOON Format Support

UBS automatically installs the high-performance toon_rust encoder for 
`--format=toon` output. This provides ~50% smaller output compared to 
JSON, optimized for LLM token efficiency.

The Rust encoder is ~10x faster than the Node.js alternative and requires
no runtime dependencies.
```

Update Output Formats section:
```markdown
- `--format=toon` - TOON format (~50% smaller, uses toon_rust encoder)
```

### 2. install.sh help text

Update usage message to mention TOON encoder installation.

### 3. ubs --help

Already updated (TOON_BIN documented). Verify accuracy.

### 4. RESEARCH_FINDINGS.md

Update the documentation to reflect:
- Binary is installed as toon-encode (not tr)
- Auto-detection in ubs script
- No manual configuration required

## Key Messages

1. **Zero configuration** - Works out of box
2. **Performance** - 10x faster than Node.js
3. **Fallback** - Gracefully uses Node.js if Rust binary unavailable
4. **Override** - TOON_BIN env var for custom setups

## Dependencies

- bd-3a6.6 (Test: ensure implementation is verified before documenting)

## Notes

Documentation should be updated AFTER testing confirms everything works.
Avoids documenting features that may change during implementation.

title: Graceful fallback if tr binary not in PATH
description: When --format=toon is requested but the tr binary is not found in PATH, emit a warning to stderr and fall back to JSON format. Check with command -v tr or which tr. Print: 'Warning: tr (TOON encoder) not found in PATH; falling back to --format=json'. This prevents hard failures in environments without tr installed.
notes: Implemented fallback to JSON with warning when toon binary not in PATH

title: Add --stats flag for token comparison display
description: When --stats is passed alongside --format=toon, append token savings statistics to the output. This leverages tr --stats which outputs 'Token estimates: ~N (JSON) -> ~M (TOON), Saved ~K tokens (-X.Y%)'. Implementation: pass --stats to the tr invocation when this flag is set.
notes: Fallback to JSON with warning when toon not in PATH

title: Add progress indicators to UBS runner
description: User reports UBS hangs with no output on large projects. The meta-runner swallows output and waits silently. We need real-time progress updates to identify which scanner is hanging.

description: Investigate modules/ubs-python.sh and modules/helpers/resource_lifecycle_py.py for potential bugs and improvements.

title: Fix uninstall command input handling

title: verify.sh: portable SHA256 + version normalization
description: scripts/verify.sh currently hard-depends on GNU sha256sum and its --check mode, which breaks on macOS defaults. It also documents '--version vX.Y.Z' but unconditionally prefixes 'v' in the release URL, causing 'vvX.Y.Z' if users include the leading v. Fix by (1) using a portable sha256 helper (sha256sum/shasum/openssl) and direct digest compare, (2) accepting --version with or without leading 'v', (3) failing cleanly if neither curl nor wget is present.

title: Expand non-JS manifest coverage

title: Fix rust type narrowing helper path anchoring
description: modules/helpers/type_narrowing_rust.py uses BASE_DIR=Path.cwd() for is_safe_path checks; when ubs is run against an absolute project path from a different CWD, helper treats the project as unsafe and skips scanning. Anchor safety checks to the provided project root instead.

title: Update ubs help and README with TOON documentation

However, for large findings arrays within each JSONL record, tabular format could still help. Low priority - evaluate after primary TOON integration is complete.

notes: Added modules/helpers/type_narrowing_ts.js and run_type_narrowing_checks in ubs-js.sh; analyzer runs via Node+TypeScript with fallback heuristics.

title: ubs doctor: verify ast-grep availability (and fix if tool cache exists)

title: ubs: standardize exit code 2 as 'environment error' and surface it nicely
description: If language modules adopt exit code 2 for dependency/environment failures (e.g., JS module refusing TSX fallback without ast-grep), the ubs meta-runner should recognize and report it distinctly from 'findings' failures.

title: ubs: auto-provision ast-grep via verified tool cache
description: Users may run the standalone ubs script without install.sh (e.g., CI curl-download). To prevent JS/TS runs from silently degrading into regex/heuristic mode, teach the ubs meta-runner to download a pinned ast-grep release into a local tool cache and verify it before use.

title: Type narrowing heuristics fallback
description: When tsserver isn't available, enforce structural heuristics via ast-grep (null guards, Array.isArray, discriminated unions). Add YAML rules + shell glue so scans still warn. Ensure rules suppress obvious false positives.
notes: Fallback heuristics implemented inside type_narrowing_ts.js (text-based scan when TypeScript module missing) and integrated into ubs-js run_type_narrowing_checks.

This causes modules like ubs-golang.sh to fail when they try to invoke helpers/resource_lifecycle_go.go. Modules should likely embed their helpers or the distribution mechanism needs to handle directory downloads.
